original: Höglund, Carl Anton, postmästare, Ronneby, f. 6/2/85 i Sthlm av Gustaf H. o. Theresia Ljungberg. G. 2. 25 m. Elin Windh. Barn: Alice f. 11. — Mogiex. i Sthlm 03, res:off:ex. 05. E. o. postexp. i s. distr. 06, e. bitr. v. järnv:posten där 08, bitr. postexp. där 10, postexp. där 11, i Trelleborg 23, i Halmstad 24, postassist. där 25, i Lid-köp. 28, förste postassist. i Munkedal 30, postmäst. i Hällefors 31, dito i Ronneby sed. 39.
translated: Höglund, Carl Anton, postmaster in Ronneby, born on February 6, 1885 in Stockholm to parents Gustaf H. and Theresia Ljungberg. Married twice, first in 1902 to Elin Windh, with whom he had a daughter, Alice, born in 1911. Carl passed the Mogiex exam in Stockholm in 1903 and the reserve officer exam in 1905. He worked as a temporary postal clerk in the southern district in 1906, as a deputy for the railway mail service in 1908, as a deputy postal clerk in 1910, and as a postal clerk in 1911, all in Stockholm. He worked as a postal clerk in Trelleborg in 1923, in Halmstad in 1924, as a postal assistant in Lidköping in 1925, and as a first postal assistant in Munkedal in 1930. He became the postmaster of Hällefors in 1931 and then the postmaster of Ronneby in 1939.
